decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to use cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while smashing in with Reality Smasher and other aggressive creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void and Blast Zone to control the board and maintain pressure. The mana base is optimized to consistently cast the deck's powerful threats. Overall, this deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, utilizing removal spells, and deploying threat cards like Teferi, Jace, and Oko. The deck aims to have card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command while also maintaining flexibility with cards like Mystic Sanctuary and Field of Ruin. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and to take advantage of cards like Arcum's Astrolabe. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and dictate the pace of the game through control and powerful planeswalkers.

This deck aims to apply pressure early on with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, backed up by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Liliana of the Veil and Oko, Thief of Crowns provide additional disruption and control elements, while Wrenn and Six adds card advantage and recursion. The deck also has removal in the form of Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy, ensuring that the opponent's threats are dealt with efficiently. The land base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive and disruptive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent through direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Lava Dart, as well as utilizing creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to apply pressure. This deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero by efficiently utilizing cheap spells and creatures to outpace the opponent's defenses. The inclusion of cards like Light Up the Stage and Bedlam Reveler helps to maintain card advantage and ensure a steady stream of threats to overwhelm the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently use infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, along with pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa, to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The deck also includes protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense to keep the infect creatures safe, along with Noble Hierarch to ramp up mana. The goal is to win the game through infect damage before the opponent can build up their board or gain life to prevent it.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Mishra's Bauble, Thought Scour, and Street Wraith in order to power out early Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler threats. The deck aims to control the game with disruption spells like Stubborn Denial and Thoughtseize while also having the potential for explosive wins with Temur Battle Rage. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for additional value from previously cast spells, and The Royal Scions can provide card filtering and additional benefits to your creatures.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, disrupting opponents with Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust, and utilizing Ugin, the Ineffable and Karn, the Great Creator for additional value and removal. The deck aims to apply early pressure and overwhelm opponents with large threats while also being able to adapt to different matchups through its versatile card choices and land destruction options.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage provided by Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck uses Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Batterskull to close out the game. Celestial Colonnade provides a win condition in the form of a land that can turn into a creature. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy while generating value from its own spells and creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Sakura-Tribe Scout to play Primeval Titan as soon as possible. Once Primeval Titan is on the battlefield, it can fetch utility lands like Field of the Dead or Slayers' Stronghold to create a powerful board state or enable game-ending combos. The deck also includes cards like Engineered Explosives and Reclamation Sage for removal and disruption, while Pact of Negation offers protection for key plays. Overall, the goal is to assemble a strong mana base and powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using powerful red spells and disruptive artifacts to slow down the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void to restrict the opponent's mana base and spell casting, combined with cards like Ensnaring Bridge to prevent attacks, this deck aims to buy time to establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Legion Warboss and Goblin Rabblemaster. Karn, the Great Creator offers additional utility by accessing artifacts from the sideboard to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Glimpse the Unthinkable and Once Upon a Time to enable the dredge mechanic. By recurring creatures like Vengevine, Prized Amalgam, and Gravecrawler, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a strong board presence. Stitcher's Supplier and Hedron Crab help to fill the graveyard, while Creeping Chill provides additional reach and life gain. The goal is to aggressively mill and recur creatures from the graveyard to create a fast and consistent combo that overwhelms the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian combo to create infinite copies of Felidar Guardian, triggering an infinite loop that can either deal direct damage to the opponent or generate infinite mana with Oath of Nissa. The deck utilizes Teferi, Time Raveler to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Cards like Wall of Blossoms and Ice-Fang Coatl provide card draw and defense, while Oko, Thief of Crowns can control the board and create additional threats. Jace, the Mind Sculptor offers additional card advantage and manipulation.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures with powerful abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing mana ramp cards like Urza's lands and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can cast big threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer early in the game. Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator help control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust to deal with threats, while Ugin, the Ineffable provides additional value and board control. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board presence to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Amulet of Vigor and Azusa, Lost but Seeking to play Primeval Titan as soon as possible. Using lands like Simic Growth Chamber and Castle Garenbrig allows for explosive plays and the ability to search for powerful lands like Field of the Dead. Summoner's Pact and Once Upon a Time help find the necessary pieces, while Engineered Explosives and Reclamation Sage provide answers for opposing threats. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic, Spell Queller, and Snapcaster Mage. The key strategy is to maintain board presence with efficient threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and tempo with cards like Cryptic Command and Teferi, Time Raveler. By leveraging a mix of proactive and reactive elements, this UWx Midrange deck aims to outvalue opponents and grind out wins through incremental advantages.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Eldrazi lands, allowing for the deployment of powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells. Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator are used to lock down opponents' spells and activate artifact-based synergies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats like Reality Smasher and Walking Ballista, while also disrupting their game plan with Thought-Knot Seer and All Is Dust. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to quickly close out games in the Modern format.
